p: Selenium (Se) is one of the most important trace elements without which the body cannot function properly. In terms of its chemical structure, selenium is one of the chalcogens. It occurs in two forms: inorganic (selenates and selenites) and organic (selenomethionine and selenocysteine) [ 88]. Selenium should be supplied to the human body with foods of plant and animal origin [ 26, 88] ( Table 1).
